item.title: Chickasaw National Recreation Area Land Exchange Act of 2004

item.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 728.
Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Reported by Senator Dodd with an amendment in the nature of a substitute. With written report No. 108-369.
Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Reported by Senator Dodd with an amendment in the nature of a substitute. With written report No. 108-369.
Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Ordered to be reported with an amendment in the nature of a substitute favorably.
Committee on Energy and Natural Resources Subcommittee on National Parks. Hearings held. With printed Hearing: S.Hrg. 108-704.
Read twice and referred to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources.

item.title: S. 2374, Chickasaw National Recreation Area Land Exchange Act of 2004
item.description: Cost estimate for the bill as ordered reported by the Senate Committee on Energy and Natural Resources on September 15, 2004

item.title: S. 2374, Chickasaw National Recreation Area Land Exchange Act of 2004
item.description: Cost estimate for the bill as ordered reported by the Senate Committee on Energy and Natural Resources on September 15, 2004

item.text: For further action, see H.R.4066, which became Public Law 108-389 on 10/30/2004.

summary.text: Chickasaw National Recreation Area Land Exchange Act of 2004 - Provides for the simultaneous conveyance of Federal and non-Federal land in or adjacent to the Chickasaw National Recreation Area (Recreation Area) in Oklahoma between the Federal Government and the Chickasaw Nation. Directs the Secretary of the Interior to: (1) place in trust Federal land conveyed to the Chickasaw Nation to allow the construction of a cultural center and to protect the watershed and riparian resources of the Recreation Area; and (2) revise the boundary of the Recreation Area to reflect the acquisition of non-Federal land conveyed to the United States by the Chickasaw Nation.

Chickasaw National Recreation Area Land Exchange Act of 2004 - Directs the Secretary of the Interior to: (1) convey to the Chickasaw Nation the Chickasaw National Recreational Area land (Recreation Area) and interests in the land not later than 180 days after the Chickasaw National conveys certain non-Federal land located adjacent to the existing boundary of the Recreation Area; and (2) appraise the lands conveyed to ensure that they are of approximately equal value.

Prohibits any exchange of land until the completion of all provisions included in the Preliminary Exchange Agreement among the city of Sulphur, Oklahoma, the Chickasaw Nation, and the National Park Service, executed on July 16, 2002.

Directs the Secretary, upon completion of the land exchange, to: (1) revise the boundary of the Chickasaw National Recreation Area to reflect the exchange; and (2) administer the land acquired by the United States in accordance with applicable laws.

bill.title: Chickasaw National Recreation Area Land Exchange Act of 2004

item.title: Chickasaw National Recreation Area Land Exchange Act of 2004
A bill to provide for the conveyance of certain land to the United States and to revise the boundary of Chickasaw National Recreation Area, Oklahoma, and for other purposes.
Chickasaw National Recreation Area Land Exchange Act of 2004

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
